info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 3:18PM MDT until June 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT/445 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO...NORTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... SOUTHERN CHEYENNE AND NORTHERN SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 317 PM MDT/417 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles east of Bonny Reservoir, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. Accumulating hail is occurring with this storm. SOURCE...Public. Golfball size hail was occurring 15 miles NNW of Goodland. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... St. Francis, Hale and Wheeler. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
